instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1286: What is A1286? A1286 is a model number for a 15 inch size MacBook Pro Unibody from years Late 2008, Mid 2009, Mid 2009 , Mid 2010, Early 2011, Late 2011, Mid 2012 with EMC 2255, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-2330, 820-2532, 820-2523, 820-2533, 820-2850, 820-2915, 820-3330..
definitions.820-2915: What is 820-2915? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B no boot
threads.message:
Hi,

I have an <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B, that doesn't boot. It shows the Apple logo, the loading bar starts to load, but then the logo disapers and the screen stays a bit light grey.
Already replaced the disk, and the disk cable, but with the same result.

Without the disk, the question mark signal stays on screen forever.

Don't know where to start. Can you help?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B no boot
threads.message: Its a 2915, it has a bad GPU.  disable the AMD gpu and it will work again.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B no boot
threads.message:
Classic GPU problem.
The image disappears at the moment macOS tries to load GPU driver.
Easy to disable in BIOS, or flashing GMUX.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B no boot
threads.message: I suposed that it was a GPU problem, but because it didn't boot in safe mode, i was asking to be sure. Tks.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B no boot
threads.message:
Hi.
I've disabled GPU with medusa, removed the resistance, but after a few days the problem returns. What else can i do?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B no boot
threads.message: Did you protect the MacBook with EFI password against PRAM reset?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B no boot
threads.message:
Hi,
no I haven't done it before. I've set a firmware password now, but it worked for a few times, and them it gets the same behavier, even with the firmware password

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B no boot
threads.message:
So is not caused by undesired PRAM reset.
Did you remove <RESISTOR>R8904</RESISTOR>/11?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B no boot
<MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B no boot
<MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B no boot
threads.message:
Hi,
Couldn't find the  EFI ASD . Do you know any link for download?
